column3: A collaborative annotation tool for the treebank developement. It allows the creation of lexicons from annotated data. To ensure effective collaboration, ArboratorGrew provides a tag system.
column12: The software is freely available online (with sign up option)
column16: The data can be exported, The data can be stored with a third party storage platform (e.g. Git repository)
column20: Tokens (e.g. part-of-speech tags), Multi-tokens (e.g. multi-word expressions), Relations (e.g. dependencies)
column25: Image (e.g. a graph or coloured text), Table, Raw format (e.g. CONLL-U)
column28: annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data
column41: ArboratorGrew can be used also to teach syntax: users can create exercises with different levels of complexity and export results

column3: BoAT (Boğaziçi University Annotation Tool) is a collaborative grammatical annotation tool.

column3: brat rapid annotation tool is a web-based tool for text annotation. brat is designed in particular for structured annotation, where the notes are not freeform text but have a fixed form that can be automatically processed and interpreted by a computer.

column20: Tokens (e.g. part-of-speech tag morphological features), Spans (e.g. names entities), Multi-tokens (e.g. multi-word expressions), Relations (e.g. dependencies), Chains (e.g. coreferences)

column3: CoNLLU-editor is a graphical tool to annotate sentences in dependency syntax
column12: The software should be run by the user (own machine/server)
column20: Tokens (e.g. part-of-speech tag morphological features), Spans (e.g. names entities), Multi-tokens (e.g. multi-word expressions), Relations (e.g. dependencies)

column41: The tool supports git and provides automatic transliteration of non-Latin scripts into Latin-script, as well as statistics (number/percentage of UPOS, deprels, etc). The tool can be used as a frontend to an parser which returns the result in CoNLL-U format

column3: WebAnno is a web-based collaborative tool for linguistic annotation that supports various annotation tasks, including POS tagging, dependency parsing, and coreference resolution. It provides collaborative features and works well with formats like CoNLL-U.
column12: The software is available upon request (the user should ask to get an account)
column16: The data can be exported, The data can be stored with a third party storage platform (e.g. Git repository)

column41: WebAnno supports a rich set of features including customizable annotation layers, integration with external data sources, support for multiple annotators, and visualization of annotated data It also supports automatic pre-annotation and inter-annotator agreement calculation
